title: 107_hr3505
content: The Act may be cited as the "Airport Security Personnel Protection Act" and includes definitions for key terms. SEC. 2. DEFINITIONS. This Act defines key terms such as "airport security screener," "lawful permanent resident alien," and "qualified lawful permanent resident alien." TRANSITIONAL EMPLOYMENT ELIGIBILITY FOR QUALIFIED LAWFUL PERMANENT RESIDENT AIRPORT SECURITY SCREENERS. Special Transition Rule for Qualified Lawful Permanent Resident Aliens: Allows hiring or continued employment as an airport security screener for aliens until naturalization process is completed, with certification from the Attorney General to the Under Secretary of Transportation for Security. Transportation for Security with respect to the alien; Under Secretary of Transportation for Security certifies to Attorney General regarding alien's status as lawful permanent resident awaiting naturalization approval. The alien is awaiting a ceremony for the administration of the oath of renunciation and allegiance as required by the Immigration and Nationality Act. An application for naturalization is pending, or the alien satisfies the residence requirements within one year. The alien must file an application for naturalization within 180 days of the enactment of the Airport Security Personnel Protection Act and receive certification from the Under Secretary of Transportation for Security to be eligible for employment. The amendment allows for the continued employment of aliens who meet security screener qualifications and have completed required investigations. The amendment allows for the continued employment of aliens who meet security screener qualifications and have completed required investigations, deemed effective as if included in the enactment of the Aviation and Transportation Security Act. SEC. 4. EXPEDITED NATURALIZATION FOR QUALIFIED LAWFUL PERMANENT RESIDENT AIRPORT SECURITY SCREENERS. The Attorney General must expedite the processing of naturalization applications for qualified lawful permanent resident airport security screeners to meet citizenship requirements. The Attorney General must expedite naturalization application processing for qualified lawful permanent resident aliens to meet citizenship requirements within specific deadlines. The Attorney General must expedite naturalization application processing for qualified lawful permanent resident aliens within specific deadlines, without lowering the standards of qualification set forth in the Immigration and Nationality Act.
